transportAdvice: Hangzhou has a well-developed metro system and extensive bus network that connects major tourist areas including West Lake, making public transit a practical and affordable option for visitors. Taxis and ride-hailing services are widely available, and many lakeside attractions are easily explored on foot or by bicycle.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally misty winter days with rare frost; light layers are sufficient for most outings.
Late winter brings slightly warmer days but persistent dampness; plum blossoms begin to appear.
Early spring sees mild temperatures and blooming flowers, though rain showers are frequent.
Warm and lush with frequent spring rains; West Lake is particularly scenic but expect wet days.
Warm and humid with regular rainfall; greenery is at its peak and crowds begin to build.
Hot and very humid with heavy plum rains; indoor attractions offer welcome relief.
Peak summer heat with high humidity and occasional thunderstorms; early mornings are best for sightseeing.
Remains hot and humid with possible typhoon-related rain; lotus flowers bloom on the lake.
Temperatures ease into a pleasant early autumn; one of the more comfortable months to visit.
Crisp and clear autumn weather with golden foliage; widely considered the best month to visit Hangzhou.
Cool and mostly dry with comfortable conditions; a quieter period after the autumn peak.
Cold and dry with occasional fog over the lake; a peaceful time to visit with fewer tourists.
